entries.meaning: The French language, especially as understood by an English person. [from 18th c.]
(countable, now rare) A French person. [from 18th c.]
examples: [O]ne of these d—d Parlivoos will go farther with some women in a day, than an Englishman in a month—all owing to their impudence; for a common man has as much impudence in France as a man-midwife has in England.

verbs.description: parleyvoo (third-person singular simple present parleyvoos, present participle parleyvooing, simple past and past participle parleyvooed)

entries.meaning: (intransitive, dated, humorous) To speak a foreign language, especially French.
